title: Risk dataset (Risk Data Library Schema v0.3)
description: A collection of risk data, published or curated by a single entity, consisting of one or more resources and described using metadata structured according to the [Risk Data Library Standard](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/).

id.title: Dataset identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the dataset. Use of an HTTP URI is recommended. For more information, see [how to assign a dataset identifier](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/guides/metadata/#assign-a-dataset-identifier).

title.title: Title
examples: Earthquake Hazard Maps for Southeast Asia
Urban Vulnerability Index for Climate Change

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the dataset.
examples: This dataset provides comprehensive flood risk assessments for major river basins worldwide, incorporating climate change projections and updated exposure data.
High-resolution earthquake hazard maps covering Southeast Asian countries, derived from probabilistic seismic hazard analysis with updated ground motion prediction equations.
Composite vulnerability index assessing urban areas' susceptibility to climate change impacts, including sea level rise, extreme temperatures, and precipitation changes.

risk_data_type.title: Risk data type
risk_data_type.description: The types of risk data included in the dataset, from the closed [risk_data_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#risk-data-type).

version.title: Dataset version
version.description: The version indicator (name or identifier) of the dataset.

purpose.title: Dataset purpose
purpose.description: The purpose for which the dataset was created.
examples: Risk assessment for urban planning and development
Insurance portfolio analysis and catastrophe modeling
Climate adaptation planning and policy development
Academic research on natural hazard impacts

project.title: Project
project.description: Information about the project that produced the dataset.

name.title: Project name
name.description: The name of the project that produced the dataset.

url.title: Project URL
url.description: A URL associated with the project.

details.title: Additional details
examples: This dataset was produced using state-of-the-art modeling techniques and incorporates the latest climate projections from CMIP6.
Data collection and processing followed international standards for disaster risk assessment as outlined in the UNDRR terminology.
The methodology is based on peer-reviewed research and has been validated against historical disaster events.

spatial.title: Spatial coverage
spatial.description: The geographical area covered by the dataset. If specified using coordinates, the use of `.bbox` is recommended over `.geometry` or `.centroid`.

temporal_resolution.title: Temporal resolution
temporal_resolution.description: The minimum period of time resolvable in this dataset, in ISO8601 duration format.

license.title: License
license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the dataset, taken from the open [license codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#license). A Public Domain Dedication or [Open Definition Conformant](https://opendefinition.org/licenses/) license is recommended. Documents linked from this file may be under other license conditions.

attributions.title: Attributions
attributions.description: Information about entities and their roles in relation to the dataset. Must include at least one attribution for each required role: publisher, creator, and contact_point.

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: Sources of information that contribute to the creation of the dataset.

referenced_by.title: Referenced by
referenced_by.description: Related resources, such as publications, that reference, cite, or otherwise point to the dataset.

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Information about the resources included in the dataset.

hazard.title: Hazard metadata
hazard.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe processes or phenomena that may cause loss of life, injury or other health impacts, property damage, social and economic disruption or environmental degradation.

event_sets.title: Event sets
event_sets.description: Information about sets of hazard events.

exposure.title: Exposure metadata
exposure.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe the situation of people, infrastructure, housing, production capacities and other tangible human assets located in hazard-prone areas.

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability metadata
vulnerability.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe the physical fragility and vulnerability relationships in relation to specific hazards or combinations of individual hazards.

hazard_primary.title: Primary hazard type
hazard_primary.description: The primary hazard involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#hazard_type).

hazard_secondary.title: Secondary hazard type
hazard_secondary.description: The secondary hazard involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#hazard_type).

hazard_process_primary.title: Primary hazard process
hazard_process_primary.description: The primary hazard process involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#hazard_process_type).

hazard_process_secondary.title: Secondary hazard process
hazard_process_secondary.description: The secondary hazard process involved in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#hazard_process_type).

hazard_analysis_type.title: Hazard analysis type
hazard_analysis_type.description: The type of analysis applied to the hazard data used in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [analysis type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#analysis_type).

intensity.title: Hazard intensity measurement
intensity.description: The metric and units the hazard intensity measurement is given in, from the open [intensity measure codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#IMT).

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure_category codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#exposure-category).

impact_type.title: Impact type
impact_type.description: The type of impact calculated, taken from the closed [impact_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#impact-type).

impact_modelling.title: Impact modelling
impact_modelling.description: The type of data used to calculate the impact values, taken from the closed [data_calculation_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#data-calculation-type).

impact_metric.title: Impact metric
impact_metric.description: The metric used to describe the impact, taken from the open [impact_metric codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#impact-metric).

quantity_kind.title: Quantity kind
quantity_kind.description: The kind of quantity in which the impact value is expressed, from the open [quantity_kind codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#quantity-kind).

taxonomy.title: Exposure taxonomy scheme
taxonomy.description: The name of the taxonomy scheme used to create descriptive individual asset feature strings within the dataset. Use of GED4ALL is recommended.

impact.title: Vulnerability impact
impact.description: The details of the vulnerability impact values produced in the modelled scenario(s).

functions.title: Impact functions
functions.description: Details of the functions used to calculate the vulnerability dataset.

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability function
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability function used to calculate the impact of the hazard.

approach.title: Vulnerability function approach
approach.description: The approach the vulnerability function is based upon, taken from the closed [function_approach codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#function-approach).

relationship.title: Vulnerability impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the vulnerability impact values, taken from the closed [relationship_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#relationship-type).

fragility.title: Fragility function
fragility.description: The fragility function used to calculate the impact of the hazard.

approach.title: Fragility function approach
approach.description: The approach the fragility function is based upon, taken from the closed [function_approach codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#function-approach).

relationship.title: Fragility impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the impact values, taken from the closed [relationship type_codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#relationship-type).

damage_scale_name.title: Damage scale name
damage_scale_name.description: The name of the damage scale used in the fragility function, taken from the open [damage_scale_name codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#damage-scale-name).

damage_states_names.title: Damage states names
damage_states_names.description: The names of the damage states listed in the fragility function.

damage_to_loss.title: Damage-to-loss function
damage_to_loss.description: The damage-to-loss function (or damage-to-loss model) used to calculate the impact of the hazard in conjunction with a fragility function.

approach.title: Damage-to-loss function approach
approach.description: The approach the damage-to-loss impact function is based upon, taken from the closed [function_approach codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#function-approach).

relationship.title: Damage-to-loss impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the damage-to-loss impact values, taken from the closed [relationship_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#relationship-type).

damage_scale_name.title: Damage scale name
damage_scale_name.description: The name of the damage scale used in the damage-to-loss function, taken from the open [damage_scale_name codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#damage-scale-name).

damage_states_names.title: Damage states names
damage_states_names.description: The names of the damage states listed in a damage scale.

engineering_demand.title: Engineering demand function
engineering_demand.description: The engineering demand function used to calculate the impact of the hazard.

parameter.title: Engineering demand parameter
parameter.description: The name of the engineering demand parameter, taken from the open [engineering_demand_parameter codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#engineering-demand-parameter).

approach.title: Engineering demand impact function approach
approach.description: The approach the engineering demand impact function is based upon, taken from the closed [function_approach codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#function-approach).

relationship.title: Engineering demand impact relationship type
relationship.description: The type of function relationships used to calculate the engineering impact values, taken from the closed [relationship_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#relationship-type).

analysis_details.title: Analysis details
analysis_details.description: Additional details about the analysis used to produce the vulnerability function used in the modelled scenario(s).
examples: Vulnerability functions were developed using non-linear time history analysis of representative building typologies under incremental dynamic analysis.
Empirical vulnerability curves derived from post-disaster damage surveys conducted after recent earthquake events in the region.
Analytical fragility functions developed using capacity spectrum method with updated seismic design parameters.

se_category.title: Socio-economic index category
se_category.description: The socio-economic category vulnerable to the hazard.

loss.title: Loss metadata
loss.description: Metadata that is specific to datasets that describe measures of impact in the form of damage or destruction caused by a disaster.

losses.title: Losses
losses.description: Information about the losses described in the dataset.

links.title: Links
links.description: Links to related resources. The purpose of this field is to declare the version of the RDLS schema that describes the metadata. The first item in the links array must be a link to the canonical URL of the RDLS JSON schema with relation type 'describedby'. Subsequent items must conform to an IANA link relation type other than 'describedby'. To link to  sources of information that contribute to the creation of the dataset or to related resources that point to the dataset, use `sources` and `referencedBy`, respectively.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: An individual file or other form of data. Resources can be fully informationally equivalent, such as CSV and JSON serializations of the same data. Resources can also have different levels of fidelity, such as a CSV file and a graphical representation of the data within the file. Resources can also differ in other aspects, such as the temporal coverage of each resource.

id.title: Resource identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this resource.

description.title: Resource description
examples: High-resolution flood depth maps in GeoTIFF format showing maximum water depths for 100-year return period events.
Comprehensive inventory of residential and commercial buildings including location, construction type, and replacement value.
Earthquake vulnerability functions for building typologies common in Southeast Asia, provided in JSON format.

media_type.title: Media type
media_type.description: The media type of the resource, from the open [media_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#media-type). For example a custom binary file has media_type 'application/octet-stream. A geojson file has the media_type 'application/geo+json'.

format.title: Format
format.description: A human-readable description of the file format of the resource, taken from the open [data_formats codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#data-formats).

spatial_resolution.title: Spatial resolution
spatial_resolution.description: The minimum spatial separation resolvable in this resource, measured in meters.

coordinate_system.title: Coordinate reference system
coordinate_system.description: An identifier string for the coordinate reference system (CRS) used in this resource. The CRS must be identified by a code issued by either [EPSG](https://epsg.org/) or [ESRI](https://www.esri.com/). The identifier string format is {authority}:{code}, e.g. EPSG:4326. [https://epsg.io/](https://epsg.io/) provides a searchable database of EPSG and ESRI coordinate system codes.

access_url.title: Access Url
access_url.description: A web address that gives access to this resource, e.g. a webpage through which a user can request access by completing a form.

download_url.title: Download Url
download_url.description: The web address this resource can be downloaded from in the given `.format`.

temporal.title: Temporal coverage
temporal.description: The period of time covered by this resource.

name.title: Name
examples: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR)
Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery
International Research Institute for Climate and Society

email.title: Email address
email.description: An email address for the entity.

url.title: URL
url.description: A URL associated with the entity.

Attribution.title: Attribution
Attribution.description: A qualified relation between an entity and a dataset.

id.title: Attribution identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the attribution.

entity.title: Entity
entity.description: An entity with a role in relation to the dataset.

role.title: Role
role.description: The entity's role in relation to the dataset, using the open [roles codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#roles).

Related_resource.title: Related resource
Related_resource.description: A related resource, such as a publication, that references, cites, or otherwise points to a dataset.

id.title: Related resource identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the related resource.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name or title of the resource.
examples: Global Assessment Report on Disaster Risk Reduction 2024
Climate Change and Risk Assessment: A Comprehensive Analysis
Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015-2030

author_names.title: Author names
author_names.description: The names of the authors of the resource.

date_published.title: Publication date
date_published.description: The date that the resource was first published.

url.title: URL
url.description: The uniform resource locator for the resource, e.g. the web address at which the resource can be accessed.

doi.title: Digital object identifier
doi.description: The digital object identifier for the resource.

Source.title: Source
Source.description: A source of information that contributes to the creation of a dataset.

id.title: Source identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for the source.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name or title of the source.
examples: Global Active and Passive Microwave Products

description.title: Description
description.description: The details about the source dataset or model.

lineage.title: Lineage
lineage.description: Information about the processing steps, transformations, and methodology applied to the source. Common elements include processing steps (e.g., corrections, transformations, algorithms), tools or software used, date and personnel involved. For example, describes if the source dataset/model has been clipped for the geographic region, resampled to different resolution, reprojected to a different CRS, etc.

url.title: URL
url.description: The uniform resource locator for the source, e.g. the web address at which the source can be accessed.

type.title: type
type.description: The nature of the source, from the closed [source_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#source-type).

component.title: Component
component.description: The risk data component the source has been used in, from the closed [risk_data_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#risk-data-type).

license.title: License
license.description: The license under which the source data is made available, taken from the open [license codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#license). A Public Domain Dedication or [Open Definition Conformant](https://opendefinition.org/licenses/) license is recommended.

start.title: Start
start.description: The start of the period. A date (YYYY-MM-DD) is recommended. However, year-months (YYYY-MM) and years (YYYY) are supported.

end.title: End date
end.description: The end of the period. A date (YYYY-MM-DD) is recommended. However, year-months (YYYY-MM) and years (YYYY) are supported.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The duration of the period in ISO 8601 duration format, e.g. 'P50Y' for 50 years

temporal_resolution.title: Temporal resolution
temporal_resolution.description: The minimum period of time resolvable in this resource, in ISO8601 duration format.

scale.title: Spatial scale
scale.description: The spatial scale of the geographical area, from the closed [spatial scale codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#spatial_scale).

countries.title: Countries
countries.description: The countries covered by the geographical area, from the closed [country codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#country).

gazetteer_entries.title: Gazetteer entries
gazetteer_entries.description: Entries from geographical indices or directories describing the geographical area. This field should be used to describe sub-national coverage. Use of ISO 3166-2 is recommended.

bbox.title: Bounding box
bbox.description: A geographic bounding box delimiting the geographical area. This field is an array of numbers. It must contain exactly four numbers with the first two numbers being the longitude and latitude of the most southwesterly point and the second two numbers being the longitude and latitude of the most northeasterly point. Coordinates must be specified using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium URN urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC::CRS84.

centroid.title: Centroid
centroid.description: The coordinates of the centre of the geographical area. This field is an array of numbers. It must contain exactly two numbers with longitude (easting) first and latitude (northing) second. Coordinates must be specified using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium URN urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC::CRS84.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: A set of coordinates denoting the vertices of the geographical area. This field describes the extent of the geographical area. To avoid creating very large metadata, geometries should have fewer than 50 vertices.

Gazetteer_entry.title: Gazetteer entry
Gazetteer_entry.description: An entry from a geographical index or directory describing a geographical area.

id.title: Gazetteer entry identifier
id.description: An identifier drawn from the gazetteer identified in `.scheme`.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The gazetteer from which the entry is drawn, from the open [location gazetteers codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#location_gazetteers).

description.title: Description
description.description: A description for the gazetteer entry.

uri.title: Uniform resource locator
uri.description: A URI for the gazetteer entry.

Geometry.title: Geometry
Geometry.description: A set of coordinates denoting the vertices of the geographical area.

type.title: Type
type.description: The GeoJSON geometry type that is described by `.coordinates`, from the closed [geometry_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#geometry_type).

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: One or more GeoJSON positions according to the GeoJSON geometry type defined in `.type`. Each position is an array of numbers containing exactly two numbers with longitude (easting) first and latitude (northing) second. Coordinates must be specified using the World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) datum, with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. This is equivalent to the coordinate reference system identified by the Open Geospatial Consortium URN urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC::CRS84.

Hazard.title: Hazard
Hazard.description: A phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury or other health impacts, property damage, social and economic disruption or environmental degradation.

id.title: Hazard identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this hazard.

type.title: Hazard type
type.description: The hazard type for this hazard, from the closed [hazard_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#hazard-type).

processes.title: Hazard processes
processes.description: The hazard process types for this hazard, from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#process_type).

intensity_measure.title: Intensity measure
intensity_measure.description: The metric and unit in which the intensity of this hazard is measured, from the open [intensity measure codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#IMT).

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.description: The root hazard type and process which triggered the described hazard.

type.title: Hazard type
type.description: The hazard type for this hazard, from the closed [hazard_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#hazard-type).

processes.title: Hazard processes
processes.description: The hazard process types for this hazard, from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#process_type).

Event_set.title: Event set
Event_set.description: Information about a set of hazard events.

id.title: Event set identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this event set.

hazards.title: Hazards
hazards.description: The hazards included in this event set.

analysis_type.title: Analysis type
analysis_type.description: The type of analysis used by the hazard model, from the closed [analysis type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#analysis_type).

frequency_distribution.title: Frequency distribution
frequency_distribution.description: The frequency distribution assumed for the occurrence of events over a multi-year timeline, from the [frequency_distribution codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#frequency-distribution).

seasonality.title: Seasonality distribution
seasonality.description: The seasonality distribution assumed for the occurrence of events across a calendar year, from the [seasonality_distribution codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#seasonality-distribution)

calculation_method.title: Calculation Method
calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of the event set in the modelled scenario(s), taken from the closed [data_calculation_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#data-calculation-type).

event_count.title: Event count
event_count.description: The number of events contained in the event set. You should only use this field when details of individual events are not included in the RDLS metadata.

occurrence_range.title: Occurrence range
occurrence_range.description: A summary of the probabilistic occurrence scenarios that are included in the event set. You should only use this field when `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'
examples: Events with magnitude 6.0-8.5 and return periods 100-2500 years

temporal.title: Temporal coverage
temporal.description: The period of time covered by this event set.

events.title: Events
events.description: The events in this event set.

id.title: Event identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this event.

disaster_identifiers.title: Disaster identifiers
disaster_identifiers.description: Identifiers for the disaster to which this event relates.

calculation_method.title: Model calculation method
calculation_method.description: The methodology used for the calculation of the event in the modelled scenario(s), from the closed [data calculation type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists#data_calculation_type).

hazard.title: Hazard
hazard.description: The hazard to which this event relates.

occurrence.title: Occurrence
occurrence.description: The frequency or likelihood of the event happening within a given time frame.

probabilistic.title: Probabilistic frequency
probabilistic.description: How often the event is expected to occur. Can be return period and/or probability. Both fields are provided to allow entry of return period (most common term used across all hazards) and/or probability, which is commonly used for seismic hazard. Probability commonly refers to a probability within 1 year or 50 years, but may be relative to any duration - when `probability` is used, `span` must be specified. You should only use this object when `event_set.analysis_type` = `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

empirical.title: Empirical
empirical.description: The period of time over which the event occurred and the associated return period (if any). You should only use this object when `event_set.analysis_type` = 'empirical'

temporal.title: Temporal occurrence
temporal.description: The period of time over which the event occurred.

return_period.title: Associated return period
return_period.description: Probabilistic frequency estimate associated with the empirical events in terms of hazard intensity. Expressed as the denominator of '1/n', e.g. '10' for a 1-in-10 year return period etc.

deterministic.title: Deterministic frequency
deterministic.description: The index criteria and thresholds classification used by the deterministic event set, index approaches and susceptibility data. You should only use this object when `event_set.analysis_type` = 'deterministic'.

index_criteria.title: Index criteria
index_criteria.description: Full description of the approach and criteria used to produce the index value. A deterministic hazard intensity index (ranking, score, etc) is not tied to a specific occurrence probability, rather is produced using an aggregation criteria (e.g. max, mean, median of annual values over a period; multi-criteria combination; Principal Component Analysis; else).
examples: Mean ground motion intensity based on probabilistic seismic hazard maps
Composite drought index combining SPI, SPEI, and soil moisture indicators
Principal component analysis of multiple flood indicators

thresholds.title: Index thresholds
thresholds.description: The thresholds used to classify the index value. Each threshold should be a separate item. Where thresholds are identified by both a number and a descriptor, include the descriptor in brackets, e.g. 1 (low).

description.title: Description
description.description: Provides additional information about this specific event
examples: Magnitude 7.2 earthquake scenario based on the Manila Trench fault system
Severe flooding event affecting the lower Mekong Delta during monsoon season
Category 5 super typhoon with sustained winds exceeding 250 km/h
Extended drought period affecting agricultural regions over 18-month duration

Exposure_item.title: Exposure item
Exposure_item.description: Information about a specific category of exposed assets.

category.title: Exposure category
category.description: The category of the exposed assets, from the closed [exposure_category codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#exposure-category).

taxonomy.title: Exposure taxonomy scheme
taxonomy.description: The name of the taxonomy scheme used to create descriptive individual asset feature strings within the dataset.

metrics.title: Exposure metrics
metrics.description: The measurements used to quantify the extent to which assets are exposed.

Metric.title: Asset exposure metric
Metric.description: A measurement used to quantify the extent to which assets detailed in the dataset are exposed.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A locally unique identifier for this metric.

dimension.title: Metric dimension
dimension.description: The dimension on which the asset's exposure is measured, from the closed [metric_dimension codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#metric-dimension).

quantity_kind.title: Quantity kind
quantity_kind.description: The kind of quantity by which the exposure metric is quantified, from the open [quantity_kind codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#quantity-kind). If the metric measures a quantity kind that is not included in the codelist, look up the correct code in the [QUDT Quantity Kind Vocabulary](https://www.qudt.org/doc/DOC_VOCAB-QUANTITY-KINDS.html).

Probabilistic.title: Probabilistic frequency
Probabilistic.description: How often the event is expected to occur. Can be return period and/or probability. Both fields are provided to allow entry of return period (most common term used across all hazards) and/or probability, which is commonly used for seismic hazard. Probability commonly refers to a probability within 1 year or 50 years, but may be relative to any duration - when `probability` is used, `span` must be specified. This object must only be used if `event_set.analysis_type` = 'probabilistic'

return_period.title: Return period
return_period.description: The event return period (or recurrence interval); the estimated average time between events. Expressed as the denominator of '1/n', e.g. '10' for a 1-in-10 year return period etc.

event_rate.title: Event rate
event_rate.description: The average number of occurrences of the event within a given year. This is the reciprocal of the return period, related by event_set.frequency_distribution.

probability.title: Probability
probability.description: The likelihood of the event occurring in a given time period.

value.title: Probability value
value.description: The probability of the event occurring during the time period specified in `.span`, expressed as a number between 0 and 1, e.g. 0.1 represents a 10% likelihood of the event occurring.

span.title: Probability span
span.description: The length in years of the period in which the event is likely to occur with the probability specified in `.value`.

Classification.title: Classification
Classification.description: A classification consists of at least two parts: an identifier for the list (scheme) from which the classification is taken, and an identifier for the category from that list being applied. It is useful to also publish a text label and/or URI that users can draw on to interpret the classification.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme or codelist from which the classification code is taken, using the open [classification_scheme](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#classification-scheme) codelist.

id.title: Classification identifier
id.description: The classification code taken from the scheme.

description.title: Description
description.description: A textual description or title for the classification code.
examples: Severe flooding in Central Luzon, Philippines, March 2024

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to uniquely identify the classification code.

Link.title: Link
Link.description: A link to a related resource.

href.title: Link target
href.description: The URL of this related resource.

rel.title: Link relation type
rel.description: The relationship with this related resource, from the [IANA Link Relationship Types](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1).  The 'describedby' code must only be used in the first item in the `links` array to link to the schema that describes the structure of the data.

Losses.title: Losses
Losses.description: Losses resulting from the occurrence of a hazard.

id.title: Losses identifier
id.description: A local identifier for the losses.

hazard_type.title: Hazard type
hazard_type.description: The main type of hazard that resulted in the losses, from the closed [hazard type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#hazard_type).

hazard_process.title: Hazard process
hazard_process.description: The main hazard process that resulted in the losses, from the closed [hazard process type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists.html#hazard_process_type).

asset_category.title: Asset category
asset_category.description: The category of the lost assets, from the closed [exposure_category codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#exposure-category).

asset_dimension.title: Asset dimension
asset_dimension.description: The dimension of the assets that have incurred the cost, from the closed [metric_dimension codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#metric-dimension).

impact_and_losses.title: Impact and losses
impact_and_losses.description: Details of the impact and loss calculations.

impact_type.title: Impact type
impact_type.description: The type of impact calculated, taken from the closed [impact_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#impact-type).

impact_modelling.title: Impact modelling
impact_modelling.description: The type of data used to calculate the impact values, taken from the closed [data_calculation_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#data-calculation-type).

impact_metric.title: Impact metric
impact_metric.description: The metric used to describe the impact, taken from the open [impact_metric codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#impact-metric).

quantity_kind.title: Quantity kind
quantity_kind.description: The kind of quantity in which the impact value is expressed, from the open [quantity_kind codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#quantity-kind).

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency unit when impact unit is monetary, from the closed [currency codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#currency).

loss_type.title: Loss type
loss_type.description: The type of losses, from the closed [loss_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#loss-type).

loss_approach.title: Loss approach
loss_approach.description: The approach the loss calculation function is based upon, taken from the closed [function_approach codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#function-approach).

loss_frequency_type.title: Loss frequency type
loss_frequency_type.description: The type of occurrence frequency represented in the losses, from the closed [analysis_type codelist](https://docs.riskdatalibrary.org/en/latest/reference/codelists/#analysis-type).

lineage.title: Lineage
lineage.description: Information about the datasets used in calculating the losses.

hazard_dataset.title: Hazard dataset
hazard_dataset.description: A unique identifier for the hazard dataset used in calculating the losses. Use of an HTTP URI is recommended.

exposure_dataset.title: Exposure dataset
exposure_dataset.description: A unique identifier for the exposure dataset used in calculating the losses. Use of an HTTP URI is recommended.

vulnerability_dataset.title: Vulnerability dataset
vulnerability_dataset.description: A unique identifier for the vulnerability dataset used in calculating the losses. Use of an HTTP URI is recommended.

description.title: Loss description
examples: Economic losses from Typhoon Odette affecting residential and commercial buildings in Visayas region
Structural damage to buildings caused by ground shaking during the M7.2 Bohol earthquake
Agricultural crop losses due to extended drought conditions in Central Luzon
Infrastructure damage from landslides triggered by intense rainfall
